verses.verse: Behold my <S%H5650>servant<s%>, whom I <S%H8551>uphold<s%>; mine <S%H972>elect<s%>, in whom my <S%H5315>soul<s%> <S%H7521>delighteth<s%>; I have <S%H5414>put<s%> my <S%H7307>spirit<s%> upon him: he shall bring <S%H3318>forth<s%> <S%H4941>judgment<s%> to the <S%H1471>Gentiles<s%>.
He shall not <S%H6817>cry<s%>, nor lift <S%H5375>up<s%>, nor cause his <S%H6963>voice<s%> to be <S%H8085>heard<s%> in the <S%H2351>street<s%>.

A <S%H7533>bruised<s%> <S%H7070>reed<s%> shall he not <S%H7665>break<s%>, and the <S%H3544>smoking<s%> <S%H6594>flax<s%> shall he not <S%H3518>quench<s%>: he shall bring <S%H3318>forth<s%> <S%H4941>judgment<s%> unto <S%H571>truth<s%>. smoking: or, dimly burning quench: Heb. quench it

He shall not <S%H3543>fail<s%> nor be <S%H7533>discouraged<s%>, till he have <S%H7760>set<s%> <S%H4941>judgment<s%> in the <S%H776>earth<s%>: and the <S%H339>isles<s%> shall <S%H3176>wait<s%> for his <S%H8451>law<s%>. discouraged: Heb. broken

Thus <S%H559>saith<s%> <S%H410>God<s%> the <S%H3068>LORD<s%>, he that <S%H1254>created<s%> the <S%H8064>heavens<s%>, and stretched them <S%H5186>out<s%>; he that spread <S%H7554>forth<s%> the <S%H776>earth<s%>, and that which cometh <S%H6631>out<s%> of it; he that <S%H5414>giveth<s%> <S%H5397>breath<s%> unto the <S%H5971>people<s%> upon it, and <S%H7307>spirit<s%> to them that <S%H1980>walk<s%> therein:

I the <S%H3068>LORD<s%> have <S%H7121>called<s%> thee in <S%H6664>righteousness<s%>, and will <S%H2388>hold<s%> thine <S%H3027>hand<s%>, and will <S%H5341>keep<s%> thee, and <S%H5414>give<s%> thee for a <S%H1285>covenant<s%> of the <S%H5971>people<s%>, for a <S%H216>light<s%> of the <S%H1471>Gentiles<s%>;

To <S%H6491>open<s%> the <S%H5787>blind<s%> <S%H5869>eyes<s%>, to bring <S%H3318>out<s%> the <S%H616>prisoners<s%> from the <S%H4525>prison<s%>, and them that <S%H3427>sit<s%> in <S%H2822>darkness<s%> out of the <S%H3608>prison<s%> <S%H1004>house<s%>.
I am the <S%H3068>LORD<s%>: that is my <S%H8034>name<s%>: and my <S%H3519>glory<s%> will I not <S%H5414>give<s%> to <S%H312>another<s%>, neither my <S%H8416>praise<s%> to graven <S%H6456>images<s%>.
Behold, the former <S%H7223>things<s%> are come to <S%H935>pass<s%>, and new <S%H2319>things<s%> do I <S%H5046>declare<s%>: before they spring <S%H6779>forth<s%> I <S%H8085>tell<s%> you of them.

<S%H7891>Sing<s%> unto the <S%H3068>LORD<s%> a <S%H2319>new<s%> <S%H7892>song<s%>, and his <S%H8416>praise<s%> from the <S%H7097>end<s%> of the <S%H776>earth<s%>, ye that go <S%H3381>down<s%> to the <S%H3220>sea<s%>, and all that is <S%H4393>therein<s%>; the <S%H339>isles<s%>, and the <S%H3427>inhabitants<s%> thereof. all: Heb. the fulness thereof

Let the <S%H4057>wilderness<s%> and the <S%H5892>cities<s%> thereof lift <S%H5375>up<s%> their voice, the <S%H2691>villages<s%> that <S%H6938>Kedar<s%> doth <S%H3427>inhabit<s%>: let the <S%H3427>inhabitants<s%> of the <S%H5553>rock<s%> <S%H7442>sing<s%>, let them <S%H6681>shout<s%> from the <S%H7218>top<s%> of the <S%H2022>mountains<s%>.
Let them <S%H7760>give<s%> <S%H3519>glory<s%> unto the <S%H3068>LORD<s%>, and <S%H5046>declare<s%> his <S%H8416>praise<s%> in the <S%H339>islands<s%>.

The <S%H3068>LORD<s%> shall go <S%H3318>forth<s%> as a mighty <S%H1368>man<s%>, he shall stir <S%H5782>up<s%> <S%H7068>jealousy<s%> like a <S%H376>man<s%> of <S%H4421>war<s%>: he shall <S%H7321>cry<s%>, yea, <S%H6873>roar<s%>; he shall <S%H1396>prevail<s%> against his <S%H341>enemies<s%>. prevail: or, behave himself mightily

I have long <S%H5769>time<s%> holden my <S%H2814>peace<s%>; I have been <S%H2790>still<s%>, and <S%H662>refrained<s%> myself: now will I <S%H6463>cry<s%> like a travailing <S%H3205>woman<s%>; I will <S%H5395>destroy<s%> <S%H8074><s%> and <S%H7602>devour<s%> at <S%H3162>once<s%>. devour: Heb. swallow, or, sup up

I will make <S%H2717>waste<s%> <S%H2022>mountains<s%> and <S%H1389>hills<s%>, and dry <S%H3001>up<s%> all their <S%H6212>herbs<s%>; and I will <S%H7760>make<s%> the <S%H5104>rivers<s%> <S%H339>islands<s%>, and I will dry <S%H3001>up<s%> the <S%H98>pools<s%>.

And I will <S%H3212>bring<s%> the <S%H5787>blind<s%> by a <S%H1870>way<s%> that they <S%H3045>knew<s%> not; I will <S%H1869>lead<s%> them in <S%H5410>paths<s%> that they have not <S%H3045>known<s%>: I will <S%H7760>make<s%> <S%H4285>darkness<s%> <S%H216>light<s%> <S%H6440>before<s%> them, and crooked <S%H4625>things<s%> <S%H4334>straight<s%>. These <S%H1697>things<s%> will I <S%H6213>do<s%> unto them, and not <S%H5800>forsake<s%> them. straight: Heb. into straightness

They shall be <S%H5472>turned<s%> <S%H268>back<s%>, they shall be <S%H1322>greatly<s%> <S%H954>ashamed<s%>, that <S%H982>trust<s%> in graven <S%H6459>images<s%>, that <S%H559>say<s%> to the molten <S%H4541>images<s%>, Ye are our <S%H430>gods<s%>.
<S%H8085>Hear<s%>, ye <S%H2795>deaf<s%>; and <S%H5027>look<s%>, ye <S%H5787>blind<s%>, that ye may <S%H7200>see<s%>.

Who is <S%H5787>blind<s%>, but my <S%H5650>servant<s%>? or <S%H2795>deaf<s%>, as my <S%H4397>messenger<s%> that I <S%H7971>sent<s%>? who is <S%H5787>blind<s%> as he that is <S%H7999>perfect<s%>, and <S%H5787>blind<s%> as the <S%H3068>LORD'S<s%> <S%H5650>servant<s%>?
<S%H7200>Seeing<s%> <S%H7200><s%> many <S%H7227>things<s%>, but thou <S%H8104>observest<s%> not; <S%H6491>opening<s%> the <S%H241>ears<s%>, but he <S%H8085>heareth<s%> not.
The <S%H3068>LORD<s%> is well <S%H2654>pleased<s%> for his <S%H6664>righteousness'<s%> sake; he will <S%H1431>magnify<s%> the <S%H8451>law<s%>, and make it <S%H142>honourable<s%>. it: or, him

But this is a <S%H5971>people<s%> <S%H962>robbed<s%> and <S%H8154>spoiled<s%>; they are all of them <S%H6351>snared<s%> in <S%H2352>holes<s%> <S%H970><s%>, and they are <S%H2244>hid<s%> in <S%H3608>prison<s%> <S%H1004>houses<s%>: they are for a <S%H957>prey<s%>, and none <S%H5337>delivereth<s%>; for a <S%H4933>spoil<s%>, and none <S%H559>saith<s%>, <S%H7725>Restore<s%>. they are all: or, in snaring all the young men of them for a spoil: Heb. a treading
Who among you will give <S%H238>ear<s%> to this? who will <S%H7181>hearken<s%> and <S%H8085>hear<s%> for the time to <S%H268>come<s%>? for: Heb. for the after time?

Who <S%H5414>gave<s%> <S%H3290>Jacob<s%> for a <S%H4933>spoil<s%> <S%H4882><s%>, and <S%H3478>Israel<s%> to the <S%H962>robbers<s%>? did not the <S%H3068>LORD<s%>, he against <S%H2098>whom<s%> we have <S%H2398>sinned<s%>? for they <S%H14>would<s%> not <S%H1980>walk<s%> in his <S%H1870>ways<s%>, neither were they <S%H8085>obedient<s%> unto his <S%H8451>law<s%>.

Therefore he hath <S%H8210>poured<s%> upon him the <S%H2534>fury<s%> of his <S%H639>anger<s%>, and the <S%H5807>strength<s%> of <S%H4421>battle<s%>: and it hath set him on <S%H3857>fire<s%> round <S%H5439>about<s%>, yet he <S%H3045>knew<s%> not; and it <S%H1197>burned<s%> him, yet he <S%H7760>laid<s%> it not to <S%H3820>heart<s%>.
